title: How to Make Milky Peanut Butter Yema Candy

steps.headline: Mix the condensed milk, sugar and peanut butter in a blender.
steps.description: Add the blended mixture to a saucepan and boil for a few minutes just to dissolve the sugar particles.

steps.headline: Boil for a few minutes until sticky in consistency.
steps.description: Just before you turn the stove off, add the powdered milk and mix through thoroughly. Don't worry––it is supposed to have a powdery texture when you eat it.

steps.headline: Cool it down.
steps.description: Drop evenly sized little blobs of the mixture onto a non-stick surface, such as a silicone sheet or sheet of wax paper to cool. Once each candy has cooled, it is ready to wrap.

steps.headline: Wrap in individual pieces of cellophane or wax paper.
steps.description: Wind the top to keep the wrapper in place, or tie with raffia or similar. Finished.
